thread.title: Oregon Ducks vs. Washington State Cougars: Live updates from Autzen Stadium, game day guide
thread.title_full: Oregon Ducks vs. Washington State Cougars: Live updates from Autzen Stadium, game day guide | OregonLive.com

author: Molly Blue | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Oregon Ducks vs. Washington State Cougars: Live updates from Autzen Stadium, game day guide
text:
The Oregon Ducks (3-2, 1-1 Pac-12) play host to the Washington State Cougars (2-2, 0-1) Saturday. Kickoff at Autzen Stadium is scheduled for 3:07 p.m., Pacific time.
Oregon is coming off a 41-24 win at Colorado where the offense relied on a running game led by Royce Freeman , who finished with 163 yards and two touchdowns.
Freeman, who has scored at least one touchdown in 20 games at Oregon, needs 22 more rushing yards to reach the 2,000-yard mark. He's moving up the Ducks career touchdown ranks, needing four more to break into the program's top five.
And which Washington State squad will show up at Autzen Stadium? The team that lost to Portland State in the season opener? Or the one that nearly defeated California last week?
The Ducks' secondary, which has been wobbly, now faces a significant test against Cougars quarterback Luke Falk, who has averaged 364.5 yards per game this season, fifth-highest in the nation.
Here's what you need to know to watch the game and follow it online:
What : Oregon Ducks vs. Washington State Cougars
When : 3 p.m. Pacific, Saturday
Where : Autzen Stadium, Eugene
Weather : Chance of afternoon rain, 70s
TV : Pac-12 Network (Comcast 420/720, CenturyLink 687/1687 in Portland area; Dish 409; not available on DirecTV)
Radio : KXTG (750 AM, 102.9 FM), KUGN-AM (590)
Live stream : Cable and satellite customers who get Pac-12 Networks as part of their subscription can live stream the game via Pac-12 Now online , or through the Pac-12 Now app on their phone or tablet.
Live chat : Join us here at oregonlive.com/ducks with your opinions and observations and for updates throughout the game.
